block.p: LaZette Danisha Williams, a daughter of Jean H. Williams of Kew Gardens, Queens, is to be married this afternoon to Raymond Lafontant, a son of Mary and Erubin Lafontant of Brooklyn. The Rev. Willis N. Reed, a Seventh-day Adventist minister, officiated at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

The bride, 25, is the administrative assistant in the fragrance marketing department of Estee Lauder, the cosmetics company in Manhattan. She is also studying fashion merchandising and management at the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her mother is an administrative assistant in Brooklyn with the client-access services department of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

LaZette Danisha Williams, a daughter of Jean H. Williams of Kew Gardens, Queens, is to be married this afternoon to Raymond Lafontant, a son of Mary and Erubin Lafontant of Brooklyn. The Rev. Willis N. Reed, a Seventh-day Adventist minister, officiated at Oheka, the Otto Kahn house in Cold Spring Hills, N.Y.

The bride, 25, is the administrative assistant in the fragrance marketing department of Estee Lauder, the cosmetics company in Manhattan. She is also studying fashion merchandising and management at the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her mother is an administrative assistant in Brooklyn with the client-access services department of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

The bridegroom, 28, is a vice president and a bond trader in the Manhattan office of Societe Generale, the French bank. He graduated from Howard University. His mother, who is retired, was a home-care attendant in Brooklyn. His father, also retired, was a cabdriver in New York. WEDDINGS
